name: Hampton Inn San Diego - Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights Sept 07, good location, helpful staff, internet was useful. breakfast was ok, but I am a fussy eater. Good price for the location, did not notice any noise problems.
reviews.title: Not a bad hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is located adjacent to the railroad and trolley tracks on Pacific Hwy. As a result, we spent 3 sleepless nights of noise there in December. Adding to our discomfort was the primitive heating system without a thermostat. When it was on, it blew constant hot, dry air. When it was off, it was too cold to be comfortable. There were other hotels located adjacent to the tracks. Thus, it's advisable when booking a hotel in downtown San Diego to avoid accommodations on Pacific Hwy.
reviews.title: Misery of constant train NOISE!
Noisy!
reviews.text: Hotel accommodations are okay, but if you're a railroad noise fan, this is the perfect place to stay. Train noise at adjacent tracks was provided for free night and day.

reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay at this Hampton...
reviews.text: We actually enjoyed our 8-day stay in this Hampton Inn. We really enjoyed the comforts that this hotel provided such as:
- free breakfast (which was actually a really good spread and not just a continental style)
reviews.title: great breakfast

reviews.text: I enjoyed this hotel because of the many advantages:
reviews.title: one negative, lots of positives

likes.liked: — It was so close to everyplace I wanted to go.

reviews.text: It's a very short drive to the airport, and the hotel has a complimentary shuttle.
reviews.title: Room was nice. Noise was loud.
Good Location, Good Price, Bad Trains
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great area, minutes from the water and minutes from great restaurants in Little Italy.
The staff is very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's cabled AND wireless internet in the room.
reviews.title: Served it's purpose
It was ok
reviews.text: Let's start with the good. The location is good, we like this part of San Diego. The staff is very nice and helpful. The trains didn't really bother us like they did for some others. We heard them in the evening the early night, but they never woke us. As for what is in the middle, neither great nor horrible, I'd say the breakfast qualifies. It is breakfast, but I wouldn't call it particularly delicious by any means; rather fuel for the morning. Now for the bad. The furniture was rather worn in the room, particularly the coffee table; really could use replacing. And finally, the parking was horrible. Although we were able to park each night in the garage, for which you pay and that's ok, the spaces were terribly small. One morning it took a 25 point turn to get my car out of it's spot.

reviews.title: Great Pre-Cruise Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here before our Holland America Cruise. The shuttle picked us up at the airport and then took us to the ship the next morning. There was 5 of us so we had a lot of luggage!!! We had two rooms one facing the courtyard and the other in front facing the bay. Both rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. All the staff was very friendly nad helpful. It is walking distance to the waterfront and a few blocks from the mall. We took the trolley downtown just to sightsee. The breakfast had very good variety and was kept well stocked and clean. For the price it was better than any other hotel in this area. We saw our ship come in on Saturday morning. We didn't notice any of the noise that others complained about but then again I requested rooms close to the front of the hotel. I have recommended this hotel to quite a few people and they all enjoyed it as much as we did.

Excellent value for San Diego, room was clean and comfortable with good breakfast in the morning, we did have to pay for parking but hey we were in downtown SD. Staff was friendly and accommodating. In future we would stay again.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: If not for this location being easily in view of the San Diego Harbor --- this would be just another average hotel.
reviews.title: 2x staying; this x for 3 days!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If not for this train whistling noise this time - I would have given excellent.
reviews.title: Great stay
Staying at the Train Station
reviews.text: I have stayed at many Hampton Inns and have never been disappointed until now. First of all this is an old property and had a depressing interior. But, that is not the worst thing about this hotel. There are four busy train tracks next to the hotel. All four tracks are busy throughout the day, and night. I should have known something was wrong when I arrived in my room and there were two pairs of ear plugs on the nightstand. If I would have used them, it would have not been enough. The trains are LOUD!!! You would think that the trains and noise would slow down late at night, but no. The trains come by every 10 or 15 minutes until about midnight and then arrive every 30 minutes until 6:00 am when they increase in frequency. The ringing barricades for the streets can be heard with every train. The guys driving the trains must delight in sounding the horns as much as possible. I paid $131 for one night and checked out as soon as possible the next morning. I checked in to the Hilton Resort at Torey Pines, about 20 minutes away and it was one of the nicest properties I have stayed at, and it was the same rate at $131.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the good parts. You will not find a better central location for seeing the sites in and around San Diego. The hotel is located approx. 3 miles from the airport, one street over from the water front. Compared to the hotels within a two mile area the Hampton offered the best prices by far. The hotel itself is spartan but functional. The rooms were standard hotel size and clean. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was well stocked and clean. Housekeeping was prompt and thorough. One of the things I liked is that you could open the windows and take advantage of the breeze off the water.
reviews.title: A great bargain for downtown

reviews.text: The morning breakfast was average but provided the protien to start the day and get you to lunch. As stated in previous reviews there is ample parking but it is tight. With a little manuevering you should have no problem. Check in took about 5 minutes and check out was automatic. The hotel provides a computer with printer (no charge) to print your airline boarding passes. You can also use it to check the internet for information on any sights you might plan on seeing.
reviews.title: Reasonable accomodations, but nothing special

reviews.text: Across the street is the Embarcadaro (sp) which is the city's tourist waterfront. You are within two blocks of the Maritime Museum, six blocks of the Midway Museum (fantastic tour) and about ten blocks from Seaport Village's quaint shops. They have a Crazy Shirt shop and several restaurants.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Downtown San Diego

likes.liked: — Close to the Ocean & Close to the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For dinner one only has to walk out the front door, turn right and head two blocks up the street to Little Italy. There you will find approx. two blocks of very nice restaurants. Be sure to eat at Phillipes Pizza Grotto. they have one of the few parking lots but get there early. We arrived at 4 PM and when we left about an hour later there were approx. 20 people waiting to get in. Price's are local and not touristy. And this was on a Tuesday afternoon. Heading back to the hotel you will pass a 7-11 where you can buy your Cheetos for an evening snack. If you like Mexican there is a locals taco stand next door.
reviews.title: Good Value

likes.liked: — within walkingwithin walking distance to downtown, Little Italy: short car trip to amusement parks and places of interestt
likes.disliked: — Proximity to train station: noise factor

aka: Hampton Inn San Diego - Downtown Hotel
description: Right in the heart of the Embarcadero San Diego downtown, the award-winning Hampton Inn San Diego-Downtown hotel represents the best in California hospitality. We're a 177 guest room hotel dedicated to providing the finest level of hotel comfort. Experience fun and adventure as you sail around the cruise terminal. Savor delicious Italian food in Little Italy and the Gaslamp District. Get close to wildlife at SeaWorld and the San Diego Zoo. Catch a big league game at nearby Petco Park and Qualcomm Stadium. The possibilities are endless when you visit our friendly hotel in downtown San Diego, CA. We're conveniently located just off of I-5 - only a mile from San Diego Airport and the San Diego Convention Center. Two blocks from the beauty of the San Diego Bay, we're less than half a mile from the cruise terminal.
